tasks.task: Running direct burial irrigation wire for a sprinkler system.
subtasks: Walking the property to identify obstacles (like the sidewalk).
Preparing conduit for wire protection at the sidewalk (already done in this case).
Starting at the controller in the garage and running wire around the back of the property.
Burying the 16-gauge direct burial wire in the ground, tucking it under the irrigation pipes for protection.
Leaving about 2.5 feet of wire coil near each valve for surge protection.
Using wire nuts and waterproof connections at each valve.
Ensuring all wires (red for each valve, one common) are connected to the controller.
Testing the system by powering the controller and isolating each red wire to its corresponding zone.
